data:append.description: Append cells with the specified data after the last row in starting col
examples:
$ gsheet data:append --spreadsheetId=<spreadsheetId> --worksheetTitle=<worksheetTitle> --data='[["1", "2", "3"]]'

Data successfully appended to "<worksheetTitle>"

rawOutput.name: rawOutput
rawOutput.description: Get the raw output as a JSON string

worksheetTitle.name: worksheetTitle
worksheetTitle.description: Title of the worksheet to use

spreadsheetId.name: spreadsheetId
spreadsheetId.description: ID of the spreadsheet to use

valueInputOption.name: valueInputOption
valueInputOption.description: The style of the input ("RAW" or "USER_ENTERED")

minCol.name: minCol
minCol.description: The optional starting col of the operation

args.name: data
args.description: The data to be used as a JSON string - nested array [["1", "2", "3"]]

examples:
$ gsheet data:get --spreadsheetId=<spreadsheetId> --worksheetTitle=<worksheetTitle>

(a)  (b)  (c)
A1   B1   C1
A2   B2   C2
A3   B3   C3

rawOutput.name: rawOutput
rawOutput.description: Get the raw output as a JSON string

sort.name: sort
sort.description: property to sort by (prepend '-' for descending)

filter.name: filter
filter.description: filter property by partial string matching, ex: name=foo

no-truncate.name: no-truncate
no-truncate.description: do not truncate output to fit screen

spreadsheetId.name: spreadsheetId
spreadsheetId.description: ID of the spreadsheet to use

worksheetTitle.name: worksheetTitle
worksheetTitle.description: Title of the worksheet to use

hasHeaderRow.name: hasHeaderRow
hasHeaderRow.description: If the first row should be treated as header row

range.name: range
range.description: The range to use to query the cells

minRow.name: minRow
minRow.description: The optional starting row of the operation

minCol.name: minCol
minCol.description: The optional starting col of the operation

maxRow.name: maxRow
maxRow.description: The optional ending row of the operation

maxCol.name: maxCol
maxCol.description: The optional ending col of the operation

data:update.description: Updates cells with the specified data
examples:
$ gsheet data:update --spreadsheetId=<spreadsheetId> --worksheetTitle=<worksheetTitle> --data='[["1", "2", "3"]]'

Data successfully updated in "<worksheetTitle>"
